gov.usgs.cwbquery

Class MiniSeedArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.cwbquery.MiniSeedArray

  • public final class MiniSeedArray
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is for the memory buffering in QueryMom. New miniseed are added to the array. 1) The array contains allocated miniSeed blocks from the MiniSeed pool. 2) size is the number of elements with current data, 3) maxsize is the number of elements which contains allocated miniSeed, but ones past size should be marked NSAMP_NULL

    This method allows the arrays to high water with allocated MiniSeed blocks and for some of them to be available for adding without having to free them each time a trim() operation occurs. That is trimmed blocks from the beginning of the array are marked NSAMP_NULL and moved to the end. Thus there are always maxsize blocks allocated and the once between size and maxsize (exclusive) are available to be loaded.

    The query() method is used by the TriNetServer to get blocks from the RAM directly.

      MiniSeedArray(MiniSeed ms, double duration, EdgeThread parent)
      By calling this collection with fixed timestamps and offsets, the user can have a reasonable sparse collection of known time stamps.

        By calling this collection with fixed timestamps and offsets, the user can have a reasonable sparse collection of known time stamps.
        Parameters:
        ms - A first MiniSeed block to add to the array
        duration - To track the msblks
        parent - Logging parent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException - Normally if the ms block is badly formed!

      • checkOrder

        public boolean checkOrder(java.lang.StringBuilder sb)
        Check the data structures for various problems. 1) All blocks after size to maxsize are in the NSAMP_NULL state 2) Build a RunList from the blocks in the array and compare them to the incremental runslist 3) check ordering of blocks in the array 4) Insure no null blocks are in the blocks through size Build up a StringBUilder with a list of the variances
        Parameters:
        sb - StringBuilder to put the variances in
        Returns:
        true if all looks correct.
